document.body:

Email address of friend (insert comma between multiple addresses): Your email address: Copy Me Add a brief note: Send Email Processing... Slideshow: Top fast-food restaurants absent from Minnesota
Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal by John Vomhof Jr. Date: Friday, August 12, 2011, 6:55am CDT - Last Modified: Friday, August 12, 2011, 7:03am CDT Related: Retailing&Restaurants View photo gallery (15 photos) No. 50, Krystal, $377 million in 2010 U.S. sales, 364 locations.
Of the nation's Top 50 fast-food restaurants, 15 of them have no locations in the Twin Cities.
The slideshow to the right shows the 15 that are missing. The ranking comes from QSR magazine's list of the largest fast-food joints in America. Also included are two statistics: 2010 U.S. sales for each company, and total number of U.S. locations.
The Twin Cities have 17 of the 20 biggest fast-food restaurants. Can you name the three that are missing? A clue: They are ranked Nos. 7, 11 and 15 in the country.
> Click here to see which of the three will be moving into the Twin Cities soon.
> Click here to see which restaurants moved into the Twin Cities in the last couple of years.
> Click here to take our poll on which fast-food restaurant you would most like to see enter the Twin Cities market.
